metadata.Title: CVE-2022-0812 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
An information leak flaw was found in NFS over RDMA in thenet/sunrpc/xprtrdma/rpc_rdma.c in the Linux Kernel. This flaw allows anattacker with normal user privileges to leak kernel information.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0812` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-194-generic - 4.15.0-194.205
linux-image-4.15.0-194-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-194.205
linux-image-4.15.0-194-lowlatency - 4.15.0-194.205
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-194-generic - 4.15.0-194.205
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-194-lowlatency - 4.15.0-194.205
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-45-generic - 5.4.0-45.49~18.04.2

linux-image-5.4.0-45-lowlatency - 5.4.0-45.49~18.04.2

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-45-lowlatency - 5.4.0-45.49~18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-194.205').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-45.49~18.04.2').
